segment.source: Deny access to this computer from the network (Windows 10)
segment.target: Deny access to this computer from the network (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Deny access to this computer from the network security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Deny access to this computer from the network security policy setting.

segment.source: Deny access to this computer from the network
segment.target: Deny access to this computer from the network

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Deny access to this computer from the network security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Deny access to this computer from the network security policy setting.

segment.source: This security setting determines which users are prevented from accessing a device over the network.
segment.target: This security setting determines which users are prevented from accessing a device over the network.

segment.source: Because all Active Directory Domain Services programs use a network logon for access, use caution when you assign this user right on domain controllers.
segment.target: Because all Active Directory Domain Services programs use a network logon for access, use caution when you assign this user right on domain controllers.

segment.source: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesUser Rights Assignment
segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesUser Rights Assignment

segment.source: By default, this setting is Guest on domain controllers and on stand-alone servers.
segment.target: By default, this setting is Guest on domain controllers and on stand-alone servers.

segment.source: The following table lists the actual and effective default policy values.
segment.target: The following table lists the actual and effective default policy values.

segment.source: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.
segment.target: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.

segment.source: This section describes features and tools available to help you manage this policy.
segment.target: This section describes features and tools available to help you manage this policy.

segment.source: A restart of the device is not required for this policy setting to be effective.
segment.target: A restart of the device is not required for this policy setting to be effective.

segment.source: This policy setting supersedes the Access this computer from the network policy setting if a user account is subject to both policies.
segment.target: This policy setting supersedes the Access this computer from the network policy setting if a user account is subject to both policies.

segment.source: Any change to the user rights assignment for an account becomes effective the next time the owner of the account logs on.
segment.target: Any change to the user rights assignment for an account becomes effective the next time the owner of the account logs on.

segment.source: Settings are applied in the following order through a Group Policy Object (GPO), which will overwrite settings on the local computer at the next Group Policy update:
segment.target: Settings are applied in the following order through a Group Policy Object (GPO), which will overwrite settings on the local computer at the next Group Policy update:

segment.source: When a local setting is greyed out, it indicates that a GPO currently controls that setting.
segment.target: When a local setting is greyed out, it indicates that a GPO currently controls that setting.

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: Users who can log on to the device over the network can enumerate lists of account names, group names, and shared resources.
segment.target: Users who can log on to the device over the network can enumerate lists of account names, group names, and shared resources.

segment.source: Users with permission to access shared folders and files can connect over the network and possibly view or modify data.
segment.target: Users with permission to access shared folders and files can connect over the network and possibly view or modify data.

segment.source: Assign the Deny access to this computer from the network user right to the following accounts:
segment.target: Assign the Deny access to this computer from the network user right to the following accounts:

segment.source: An important exception to this list is any service accounts that are used to start services that must connect to the device over the network.
segment.target: An important exception to this list is any service accounts that are used to start services that must connect to the device over the network.

segment.source: For example, let’s say you have configured a shared folder for web servers to access, and you present content within that folder through a website.
segment.target: For example, let’s say you have configured a shared folder for web servers to access, and you present content within that folder through a website.

segment.source: You may need to allow the account that runs IIS to log on to the server with the shared folder from the network.
segment.target: You may need to allow the account that runs IIS to log on to the server with the shared folder from the network.

segment.source: This user right is particularly effective when you must configure servers and workstations on which sensitive information is handled because of regulatory compliance concerns.
segment.target: This user right is particularly effective when you must configure servers and workstations on which sensitive information is handled because of regulatory compliance concerns.

segment.source: If you configure the Deny access to this computer from the network user right for other accounts, you could limit the abilities of users who are assigned to specific administrative roles in your environment.
segment.target: If you configure the Deny access to this computer from the network user right for other accounts, you could limit the abilities of users who are assigned to specific administrative roles in your environment.

segment.source: You should verify that delegated tasks are not negatively affected.
segment.target: You should verify that delegated tasks are not negatively affected.
